questions.questionText: Which of the following statements are true?

options.text: Node.js is both a server and client-side language

questions.explanation: Node.js used Javascript on the server-side

questions.questionText: _____ is an interactive shell that processes Node.
questions.explanation: REPL is an interactive shell that processes Node

questions.questionText: What is the full form of REPL?
questions.explanation: REPL stands for Read Eval Print Loop.

questions.questionText: Node.js is written in which language?
How can we install the node body-parser module?
questions.explanation: We use the npm install ‘module-name’ command to install the node modules. Here the required module is body-parser.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are examples of node modules?
questions.explanation: All of the above-given examples are commonly used node modules.

questions.questionText: To include the HTTP server in the node module, what function do we use?
questions.explanation: We use the require() function to include the HTTP server in the node module.

questions.questionText: How can we expose node modules?
questions.explanation: The node.js modules can be exposed using module.exports.

questions.questionText: What method is used to return the current working directory of the process?
questions.explanation: The process.cwd() is used to return the current working directory of the current process.

questions.questionText: Default scope in Node.js application is ?
questions.explanation: Local is the default scope in Node.js applications.
